API Lifecycle

Just a Proof of Concept (Main Page)

Blueprint: Design Using AsyncAPI

A blueprint for beginning an event-driven API lifecycle by designing a new API using an AsyncAPI.

Define

Defining of the API. (Additional Elements)

  • Use Cases - The business use cases for an API.
  • Schema - A machine readable plan, outline, or model for all or part of an API.
  • Events - Meaningful occurences across business operations.
  • Application - An application of an API in any shape or form.
  • Team Workspace - A team workspace for managing an API.
  • Team - The team working on an API.
  • Github Repository - A Github repository.
  • Github Repository - A Github repository.
  • Environments - Indvidual environments for each stage of an APIs evolution.
  • Prototype Collection - A collection prototype for an API.
  • Examples - Examples of API request, responses, and messages.

Develop

Developing the API. (Additional Elements)

  • OpenAPI - Instructions for a computer program in any language.
  • Design Patterns - Known API patterns for use in API design.

Operate

Provide a mock for the API. (Additional Elements)

  • Code - Instructions for a computer program in any language.
  • Business Logic - The custom rules or algorithms that handle the exchange of information between a database and user interface.

Operate

Operate an API in production. (Additional Elements)

  • Deploy - The publishing of an API into and stage of it's development and operation.
  • Secure - Ensuring that an API is secure from threats and vulnerabilities.
  • Audit - An official inspection of an API or microservices.
  • Monitor - Observing, checking, and keeping a continuous record of API processes.
  • Inform - Ensure that all stakeholders for an API have all the relevant facts and information regarding an API.

Discover

Discovery involving an API. (Additional Elements)

  • Events - Meaningful occurences across business operations.
  • Relationships - Defining and understanding the way in two concepts, objects, or people are connected with APIs.
  • Private Network - A private network for publishing APIs.
  • Public Network - A public network for publishing APIs.
  • Search - A search for APIs.
